Please tell us what has to be done: stop the torrent and replace or throw previous one and restart from here? Thanks in advance_

Stop and Remove the first posted torrent.  Open the Reseed torrent and tell it to save in the same folder (whichever you chose for the original torrent). The download will continue where it left off.  For example, if you are at 35% right now, the Reseed torrent will check and show that the file is 35% done and, when you tell it to Start, (or Force Start) the file will pick up at the last piece it has.

to get it work in Leo 10.5.x, download this

http://thepiratebay.org/tor/3595634/Age_of_Empires_3_no_cd_crack

then:


1. download the latest iPatch (3.7.1) from ipatch.org
2. mount iPatch.dmg, copy the ipatch app to your desktop.
3. rightclick iPatch app, choose "Show package contents"
4. Locate "Contents/Resources/iPatcher" (448 kb), rightclick it and choose "Show 
package contents"
5. Locate "Contents/MacOS/iPatcher" (212 kb)
6. Drag-drop onto desktop - iPatcher (212 kb)
7. download Age of Empires 3 NO CD Crack.dmg, mount it, copy to Desktop
7. rightclick Age of Empires III v1.0 UBcrack.app, choose "Show package contents"
8. locate Contents/MacOS/iPatcher
9. replace it with one from step 6
10. run Age of Empires III v1.0 UBcrack.app


Thanx to moltenmind for the tips, i was able to run mine on my leopard.

(I'll assume that whoever is torrenting this bought the game and just can't find the CD-Key or something like that.)    

This is exactly how you get this game to run on OSX 10.4.11 (Should work similarly with 10.5.whatever, but you will probably need a different CD Crack)

1) You need this to get the game to run.  No burning the game to a disk will not get around this step:  http://thepiratebay.org/torrent/3964660/Age_of_Empires_3_No-CD_Crack_Leopard_by_Nozio (This is what makes the game run, even without a CD Key/CD Disk, hence the name.)
2) Mount "Age of Empires3.toast".  If you aren't familiar with UNIX terms, it means just double click it and the OS will do all the work.  You DON'T need toast 8 titanium or whatever else!
3) On the left hand side (of Finder), you will see Age of Empires 3 listed.  Choose that and drag the "Age of Empires III.app" to your applications bar (or wherever you want to store all your THOUSANDS of Mac games).
4) Mount "Age of Empires 3 NO CD Crack.dmg"
5) Hit agree, and whatever else is listed.  When another tab comes up on the left again, choose that one, and choose the application with the same name.
6) When the .app launches, choose the location to wherever you stored Age of Empires 3.app (See step 3)
That should be about it.  If you have problems, it probably means that you have OS X 10.5.whatever.  Search the top 100 mac games and there will probably be a NO CD crack AoE3 for OS X 10.5 on there some where.

Oh, and when you play AoE3, it will create a new folder in your Documents folder, so don't delete it unless you want to get rid of all of your progress.

Although i didnt download Age of Empires 3 for Mac from this particular torrent i got mine working with 2 simple steps.

Step 1: Install AOE3 and/or Expansions

Step 2: Update AOE3 to the latest patch (1.05) and then update the expansions to the latest patch. heres a link to all the patches
http://destineergames.com/support/?page_id=88

Its that easy!

Now Age of Empire 3 should even work online, no crack needed because the latest updates remove the cd check, just download Gameranger create a free account and your good to go.

Hope this helps. If you still cant get Age of Empires III to work then its because you failed to follow my simple steps.

See you on the battlefield! xD
